snippet: Photos of a baby Rothschild giraffe at the LEO Zoological Conservation Center in Connecticut are lighting up television and computer screens around the world.
abstract: Birth of female Rothschild giraffe, and naming contest for her, is heightening awareness of   LEO Zoological Conservation Center in Greenwich, Conn; LEO, short for Lionshare Educational Organization, is private preserve largely closed to public, and is breeding ground for wild animals, offering services traditional zoos cannot.
lead_paragraph: Photos of a baby Rothschild giraffe at the LEO Zoological Conservation Center in Connecticut are lighting up television and computer screens around the world.

headline.seo: New Resident Brings Attention to Connecticut Animal Sanctuary
headline.main: Baby Giraffe Draws Attention to Sanctuary
headline.print_headline: New Resident Draws Attention to Connecticut Sanctuary
